intro: Gardoquia racemosa, commonly known as the racemose gardoquia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. Gardoquia racemosa is typically found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
